message.content:
cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.CR 

This paper deals with distributed storage systems, which are typically studied in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses repair bandwidth, which is a concept from Information Theory (cs.IT). The proposed opportunistic repair framework involves adapting to network traffic conditions, which falls under the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. The paper also discusses the benefits of the proposed framework in terms of Mean Time to Data Loss (MTTDL), which is a measure of reliability and falls under the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the security implications of the proposed framework, which falls under the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category.
